document.title: Faith Formation (Religion) Curriculum Framework Standards and Benchmarks: Grade 5

0CBA4C04C06E476886EDDC381E992E9E.description: Students will know that God made the world good.

920836DD96B14C70B0E6067A8531FCF2.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the importance of care for God’s creation.

9598FAFE8A724953B23FA50ECABFAA1A.description: Students will know that sin can imperil unity.

D3F6300256044E28B11AF98C12FEC7E2.description: Students will know that the human race forms a unity because of its origin in Adam and Eve.

AF5CBB3DF7F0457CBAAE55F5C0F4AE6D.description: Students will grow in their understanding of solidarity.

DEEE38AB2AB0441991323C17C90F20D3.description: Students will know that offending the dignity and rights of others requires reparation.

59CEFE4DAB8742FC9A34285377BFD152.description: Students will know that we should respect others.

2EBAAB9B294A4242AA3E0B1ACA608010.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the dignity of the work and the rights of others.

FBE67A06BB0B4D778DA219ED2EE81B57.description: Students will know that the celebration of the eucharist calls us to feed and nourish others.

70A6CDD27AE34403B32CAC11E6B33248.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the preferential option for the poor and vulnerable.

887529DE925F42DF973B4ED84DB825B0.description: Students will know the meaning of individual responsibility and the meaning this has for promoting the good of families and the larger society.

8A31E2568808440BA88687351E6FDC02.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the rights of all people and their responsibilities towards others.

1F8070EFB3D6483EB96D636BBB9CED17.description: Students will know that the family is the first cell of society and that society depends on families and must foster them.

1E50058647394F9DA1178789B163D339.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the call to family, community and participation in society.

A9590947870D441BBB10A751CE758784.description: Students will know that social justice is based on the dignity of the human person.

4A5CE07B7A5D4BC0994D9C82E39996FA.description: Students will know that sin wounds human dignity.

1ABBB56D97F848A29AED554DA8D3C0EB.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the life and dignity of the human person.

6F206F14718248BF9A2A24274D59CCEA.description: Students will know that social justice is based on the dignity of the human person.

837458CF43814742BFDE5F42FF95230E.description: Students will know that as Catholics we are to share our material goods with one another.

CB1DAE9B80204300AA9008B006C5CB65.description: Students will grow in their understanding of justice and service.

E1920D3506A846DBB4F2230C26DC587A.description: Students will know that the celebration of the liturgy calls us to live it and bear witness to the world.

B73364FAC1084AA89EFF042808A06038.description: Students will know that the Church is the kingdom of God present in mystery and that we are called to bring about the kingdom here on earth.

B75AF096AF094EE581B772CBF0D14FE8.description: Students will grow in their knowledge of Catholic social teaching.

53B01C2F235E453AA223ECFBD72B6D82.description: Students will know the various liturgical ministries especially that of cantor and psalmist.

0DB3438D9CDC4FC0A125585504EBB359.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the ministry of the Church.

81011278147744A789F9B8D1F0F4DA19.description: Students will know that the Bishop is the ordinary minister of Confirmation.

C6A1417D38D34E13BA667A9F57154CF6.description: Students will know that the Pope is the visible source of unity of the Church.

5B06DEF871BD4E6E86ACC03B5B4D23E5.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Church life at parish, diocesan and universal levels.

4752D3D14AFD4915A0DC8C7501564D39.description: Students will know that Jesus wants them to always grow in their faith.

717282107E454435AD96B8A3CBF9DE57.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in life-long faith formation.

0916E105A7D94C69B87D0D61CAE237E3.description: Students will know that to deliberately miss Mass on Sunday is a grave sin.

CACC08F003BD4FAB831C3485D1FF44FC.description: Students will know that by our Baptism we are called to participate fully in the liturgical life of the Church.

2DDE0FFCE300450D847414A229DDFD65.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the liturgical life of the Church.

46CE4C0CD6D045CF9F72EE684733270A.description: Students will know that as believers, we accept in faith all that God has revealed, as taught by the Church.

6C576002E8B3473EAD5C873312A1DD8D.description: Students will know that justification includes the remission of sins, sanctification and the renewal of the inner man.

D7DB16C350814A3E9B8CEA0562B4DEFE.description: Students will know that the Old Law is preparation for the Gospel and that the New Law is the grace of the Holy Spirit.

8E0D1AD51F254F95805B54FC17B28E78.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church Law.

1CFDAD1B10C2438DB8637E6C7DF23399.description: Students will know original sin and its results.

3B9B442821C34A37A316EBACC31CF621.description: Students will know that grave matter, full knowledge and deliberate consent are all three necessary to commit a mortal sin.

EF1F45D860A0478A975A35CDE74C3AAA.description: Students will know that venial sins weaken charity.

DBB1EA9E1AC34825B269491EC1AB3AE4.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Sin and Forgiveness.

B58A666B733D4BE08D09AB6A34DD0220.description: Students will know that because of the many competing influences in our lives, the good formation of our conscience is absolutely necessary.

515ACD0208314EC0A49872FE8D0361C9.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Conscience.

6A42A7748BA24F45B7C1013D0D3E030D.description: Students will know that the ninth commandment teaches Christians to respect their bodies and the bodies of others as temples of the Holy Spirit.

1D012E15E1674656BB1FB13E2F6AF2A4.description: Students will know that the eighth commandment teaches that a lie or offense against a person’s reputation may demand reparation.

D1919C172CD34A1D9686FACF283EDDA6.description: Students will know that God gave us animals to use and not to abuse.

E8B11C856D9A40EF8DE309D703EA9223.description: Students will know that the seventh commandment teaches that when we steal or defraud another we are bound to make reparation.

7CB7CE237C8C44B5AE8E24AB3108EC8A.description: Students will know that the sixth commandment teaches that sexuality involves all aspects of the human person and that Christ is the model of chastity.

0F81A74391CB41E6A9EACF0221FFBA8E.description: Students will know that the fifth commandment teaches that suicide is contrary to justice and charity and is forbidden.

6CF22D59403247B0A3AB4187782DAE25.description: Students will know that the fourth commandment upholds the family as the first cell of society and that children must help their parents as much as they can.

17E0A6AA3D054C89B9DBDF687A75C8E1.description: Students will know that Catholics have the duty of participating in Mass on Sunday and not do so deliberately is a mortal sin.

C7E31C9B86C4428EB08F74CEAE0E558D.description: Students will know that perjury is making a false oath.

937788EE2C704DDE9DFC697DC23FE0CB.description: Students will know that the first commandment requires us to pray and to avoid superstition, divination and magic.

50D4AFB201FB47798C8C2145E6612B5B.description: Students will know that our moral life begins in faith and we must avoid the sins of doubt, heresy and schism.

E15373FD0F0E4442843B723C2670A847.description: Students will know that the first commandment calls for faith, hope and charity.

18FD2DC184B9410D8BB49F52153B0BA5.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Commandments.

C9051727D9314B6CBC778319B9711579.description: Students will know that the Beatitudes present us with decisive choices and show us that happiness is to be found in God alone.

7DB4F757D224480C88A74CD89A5EAB89.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Beatitudes.

DA80398820AC48209C48FC6B6F50D99E.description: Students will know that Scripture and the teaching of the Church provide guidance for the moral life.

4406A71A680944019F0E57102E9DF85A.description: Students will know that life is a struggle between good and evil, light and darkness.

71DF40D9662140908E395CD528BAF486.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Life in Christ.

8CE6DE4757A84245AF10E61B330CDD63.description: Students will know how to pray the rosary [devotional prayer].

9CBE2A5928D44742A6710E29AC514D86.description: Students will know the Apostles Creed.

9077FADF65124643B3D5157012E38FD0.description: Students will know that when we pray “Our Father who art in heaven,” we remember that the Father’s house is our true home.

B4B146F5C4D54CB58CF177E0C64D2B6C.description: Students will know that our prayer is always heard, if we unite our prayer with that of Jesus, in the Spirit.

0E93CDF407824639BFADED3D41863287.description: Students will know that that prayer arises out of the Word of God.

F583A84FC7D243ABA7DBECA733B87ED8.description: Students will know that Jesus prayed at all the decisive moments of his life.

94BE107084AF45E6825096DE47445284.description: Students will know that even in prayer, God takes the initiative.

544311885BE140718B8B7D486C60486E.description: Students will grow in their understanding of prayer.

6001042EF54849A7BF2E1A17722CBAAE.description: Students will participate in non-sacramental penitential services in order to lead them to regularly celebrate the Rite of Reconciliation.

D12F67C4FC8F47A3AFB230B46A8CF51B.description: Students will know more of the many blessings of the Church.

4CEF084469194A87BC5DDB78DDC9D2E2.description: Students will know how to pray a Celebration of the Word.

87A832563096486EA37B27159782AABD.description: Students will know how to prayer morning and evening prayer.

387A9312D7C449E68818F63248E37E19.description: Students will grow in their understanding of other Liturgical celebrations.

8D4611B7B1854A14B8E9C24D87BCF207.description: Students will know the holy days of obligation.

1BBE620CC73940FCA3AA5ECDC70F2740.description: Students will know the different liturgical seasons that celebrate various aspects of the Paschal Mystery.

FE678600583945B9BDBCCF2E4E0FB63F.description: Students will know the meaning of the word “triduum.”

027FFC8F27A048F38D5055728ABF7DD7.description: Students will know that the Church’s year is centered on Easter.

AA0EA846656B43DC9711E594144C8F10.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Liturgical Year.

950A1BCEEDBA4A49943D0671B2AAF39C.description: Students will know that the love of husband and wife is the image of the love of Christ for his Church.

ED48DDF27E9F443CA59957ADCBD13014.description: Students will know the liturgical ministry of the deacon and his call to engage in the ministry of charity.

B7505054D8D84A8BB921E8C5864406AA.description: Students will know that the Anointing of the Sick unites us with Christ’s sufferings on the cross and gives new meaning to human suffering.

4AA1F05CF31D4FDAB63804441B4AA5F4.description: Students will know that the sacrament of reconciliation ‘reconciles’ us to God and the Church.

ABD915FB3EA54EA3B020D3A6CCD84719.description: Students will know that the sacrament of reconciliation forgives all sins after Baptism.

04D16CB5DBAE494AB2B172FA14B283DC.description: Students will know that the four main elements of the sacrament of reconciliation are: contrition, confession, penance and absolution.

640343C5DC89454887354639D37ADB72.description: Students will know that the symbols of the Eucharist are bread and wine which become the Body and Blood of Christ by the power of the Holy Spirit.

4950D7A944DE4418B9789444ACE6BAA8.description: Students will know that Christ is present at Mass in the Eucharist, the assembly, the Word, and the priest.

1345DD9A38D74A868DB07179329CAA3B.description: Students will know that we call the Eucharist the Lord’s Supper, the Holy Sacrifice, and Holy Mass.

CF631901EB2E4C39BC945286B30DE46F.description: Students will know that the Eucharist is the summit and source of Christian life.

7C6C7CE2C3B6466FA4ECD86DD21F4984.description: Students will know that we receive the “Gift” of the Holy Spirit in Confirmation.

EE4245389868497C8F55BA0359AB5181.description: Students will know that the ordinary minister of Confirmation is the bishop.

2EE932C58E2749C8AD9A8DAED31B04C3.description: Students will know that Baptism gives us new life and makes us temples of the Holy Spirit.

7CA76E46454C470FA5B10EE41CD6C00A.description: Students will know that Baptism is a sacrament of forgiveness.

4C61EE80C68D463AB194D7BEC9C51B9C.description: Students will know that through Baptism we are incorporated into Christ and share in the priesthood of Christ.

880DB5BB84254D44BA45CAB71FAEAA77.description: Students will know that Baptism makes us adopted children of God.

9ED257D6311747FB800DFCB9D48A2304.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Sacraments.

68C9597A52DF4C29BE21ACCDA2E15BD9.description: Students will know that in the liturgy of the Church, the Holy Trinity is at work.

7D89A741143B4DFA871F9F2EC9A53743.description: Students will know that through the liturgical life of the Church we are called to live what we pray.

BC38B13AF5494156AC0B4AC383E2CD11.description: Students will know that the Paschal Mystery is celebrated in the liturgy.

3521CC59475F473C90EBE60D0CCEAB74.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Worship and prayer.

F0585A53AA024A5DB00716A9ACB7A0AA.description: Students will know that the Catholic Church teaches that the saints in heaven intercede for us.

D2D53123F2844C9784808F9CDD6DAAA2.description: Students will know that the Church prays in union with Mary and entrusts her with our petitions.

71E3A085F4284B5DAB26F4C6D98567D9.description: Students will know the mystery of the Assumption teaches that Mary was assumed body and soul into heaven and is the Queen of heaven.

B2D93DB2AD5A407F8087D42A048D81B3.description: Students will know that Mary is truly the ‘Mother of God’.

6A723B54A8F040FA9246C662614F0E99.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Saints.

F07917337BA14ECFB9320E496E2425F4.description: Students will know that Jesus teaches about the Kingdom of God through parables.

7FB3C5048C8C44E8AC03EF9216868DF5.description: Students will know that the Church finds nourishment in the Scriptures.

1F95AF047E2E49EB8C91438C6EB71E83.description: Students will know that we accept in faith all that God has revealed to us.

C57351088DD94D5BBB80F3F1C87ED9D7.description: Students will know that Abraham is the great Old Testament model of faith.

791A0B6BF0D949EAA75E6C4C41D6B165.description: Students will know that ignorance of the Scriptures is ignorance of Christ [St. Jerome].

9CDE4D4A9E8F4639A968413AFA08E5CD.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Revelation.

155CE9A4CE9142F391052331BFD5571C.description: Students will know the ‘marks’ of the Church.

312C927B878F4594BE0947A05E4C3312.description: Students will know that the Pope is the visible source of unity of the Church.

6FF9864D201C4D9D935F974DC0A03854.description: Students will know that the Church has a great diversity of members.

A73CCA776E6D4B8DA61D3FBCE2B9EF6E.description: Students will know that the Church is the Body of Christ and that Christ is the head of the Body.

B07D8F2A2D2747088390AE4B00D6295F.description: Students will know that the Church is the Kingdom of God present in mystery.

9F801D97132B481085B9B8FB70D7F3F0.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church.

8DB00D005B8B47BCA9CF55E4311597F2.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit guides the leaders of our Church.

41A2EFFA6CC84B42A63BD6E518C73F6F.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit inspired the writing of the Scriptures.

0750F1A0F5044418B3029D685C8014A2.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit continues to guide the Church.

BD4317072A8F4B22BAA91B2193850C27.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Holy Spirit.

AB9D67B411024B3FBA76B84CEDF8C1AF.description: Students will know that Christ’s death was part of the mystery of God’s plan.

FA49447133164DDA931C20900E4B6397.description: Students will know that everything in the Old Testament converges on Jesus.

6DCE72CAA5EF4FFFA8B812E971E65CCE.description: Students will know the meaning of the Incarnation and that it is a distinctive sign of our Christian faith.

714987BB60694BCFB9451273A0D49BEE.description: Students will know that we can only find salvation in Jesus Christ.

07929B1B0FE1416C85885A9393B58918.description: Students will know that ‘Jesus’ means ‘God saves.’

E7A6461DBE574C519500E6EF33BB04D0.description: Students will know that the heart of catechesis is Christ.

DA2B1269287749C0A8A4666B66300577.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Son.

B8D0B1840C924C5EBCEBD89B53F29919.description: Students will know that we must respect creation and protect the environment.

40ECFFB16353429692A662DAF67981B7.description: Students will know that God created the universe and made the world good.

172C628991A344BEB4944DE49DA8F07C.description: Students will know that God is all-powerful.

C4DEEE577F01442EA05A5B3B68A1583C.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Father.

26258B1C4AAC46E59BDE4DB6FB72BD5D.description: Students will know that our destiny is to enjoy the Trinity in heaven.

4982CA32AD7E478F84B0898880E65EBB.description: Students will know that God calls us His friend and always invites us into His life.

D906C30D0E5347C4A7C3D19424AF1449.description: Students will know the many ways we experience the mystery of God.

78ADB0A6FE2C435DA5FAA17E68612D10.description: Students will know that God made us for Himself.

91746DD694234216BAF721F61C4C67B1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Triune God.
